answers.answer: so did you have a type specific herpes igg blood test done yet to know your status?do you have a regular partner and if so, have they been tested yet to know their status?grace

umm...the first time i got a blood test and they just asked if i had a cold sore cuz my test came back abnormal. i have no idea what the differences are between the tests. but like i said the second time they said anything about it i went in for the yeast infection. she just looked at me and said its herpes...she didnt test the swab or nothin, just threw it away. when i was first told i had it i only had i wanna say 2 partners, i was engaged to the first one for 6 years and the second one we were together for i wanna say 5 months at the time but of course i found out maybe last year that he was like the town bus, everyone had a turn. when i had my first "outbreak" I had and I know it is bad but I had 5 partners...i never have sex without a condom... well i did one time but literally that is it! And it was with the x fiancee. Everyone I have been with that i could get ahold said they were tested shortly after i talked to them and they came up negative

most folks are not getting tested for herpes when they ask for full std testing. no way to know if your former partners really did get tested for herpes or not.at this point I suggest getting another type specific herpes igg blood test and see what it shows. I can also look at your first herpes blood test for you if you call to get the results and post them here - e.g. hsv1 igg 4.9 and hsv2 igg 2.3 or whatever they are.
alright, thank you! I will call tomorrow and get them. I really have no idea how to read them so that would be a huge help! Thank you!
I cant get my records. they said i cant get information like that over the phone. Im going to see about stopping in tomorrow and see if someone can help me.

HIPAA laws allow you access to every test you have done and all your medical records.  There is absolutely no reason why someone can't read you the results of your test over the phone. I'm guessing you talked to a secretary of some sort who is unfamiliar with the laws about patient test results :(if they want to charge you for a copy of your test results, just tell them no thank you, you just need someone to show them to you and you can write down the results on paper!
IGM is 1.11 and IGG is 0.16. one says positive and one says neative so i have no clue. Do I have it or not?
ignore all igm test results - they aren't of much use.was that a hsv2 igg, hsv1 igg or did you only receive 1 result for both?
i had both but that is the result for the hsv 2. the hsv 1......it says for the IGG...HSV1 is 0.40 and HSV2 is 0.16
i had both but that is the result for the hsv 2. the hsv 1......it says for the IGG...HSV1 is 0.40 and HSV2 is 0.16
so why is the Igm saying positive? Would it say positive if you have a cold sore or something at the time?
IgM is a worthless test.  It can cross react with many things and shouldn't be used for herpes in adults.  The CDC states you should only be tested with an IgG test.  It is safe to ignore your igm.

if 4 months have passed since that "outbreak" episode, get another type-specific test for herpes. The blood tests take up to 4 months to become positive; so if you really have herpes and if it was a new infection, you blood test might have shown a false-negative result.
no its been about the same the last couple times i had it done. it did the same thing a couple years ago and they asked me about a cold sore...

you should not be having igm herpes testing done on you at this point with what we know about the inaccuracies of it. encourage your providers to update their herpes testing knowledge by reading the 2010 cdc herpes guidelines.

question: Alright here goes. I was tested positive for herpes last year. now me being the type of person i am i got all the information i could possibly get...I am a little confused though. Can a doctor tell its herpes just by looking at it? I am thinking maybe i could have been mis diagnosed, heres why...I went in for a yeast infection(i thought) It wasnt bad at the time but I have diabetes so i hafta have everything checked out and i get them alot...Doctor told me it was a severe bacterial infection. She gave me a cream and I used it for a few days and then it got worse, hurt so bad to go to the bathroom and take a shower and my legs hurt so I went back thinkin I was havin an allergic reaction to the meds. All she did was look at my "area" and told me i had herpes. I have read that herpes tests check for obs. Is it possible that even if i did get tested and it came back positive it could be because i already have obs in my system from my diabetes and other medical ailments? And if i have herpes why is it that nobody else seems to have it and i have not had one "outbreak" since I was diagnosed...and its been over a year
title: Really confused...need some help
